title: Planet bets on orbital data centers in partnership with Google
summary:
Planet, a company best known for providing geospatial intelligence through its constellation of imaging satellites, sees a significant opportunity in developing orbital data centers for artificial intelligence.

title: Space Force offers new Vandenberg launch site
summary:
Vandenberg Space Force Base is offering launch providers access to a new site with conditions that could enable flights of SpaceX’s Starship.

title: ESA confirms data breach
summary:
MILAN — The European Space Agency has confirmed a security breach of unclassified material from  science servers following reports on social media. A threat actor claimed to have compromised ESA systems and to have leaked roughly 200 gigabytes of data. According to screenshots shared on X by French cybersecurity professional Seb Latom, the actor alleges […]
The post ESA confirms data breach appeared first on SpaceNews.

title: Curiosity Sends Holiday Postcard from Mars
summary: Team members working with NASA’s Curiosity Mars rover created this “postcard” by commanding the rover to take images at two times of day on Nov. 18, 2025, spanning periods that occurred on both the 4,722nd and 4,723rd Martian days, or sols, of the mission. The panoramas were captured at 4:15 p.m. on Sol 4,722 and […]

title: NASA’s Chandra Rings in New Year With Champagne Cluster
summary: Celebrate the New Year with the “Champagne Cluster,” a galaxy cluster seen in this new image from NASA’s Chandra X-ray Observatory and optical telescopes. Astronomers discovered this galaxy cluster Dec. 31, 2020. The date, combined with the bubble-like appearance of the galaxies and the superheated gas seen with Chandra observations (represented in purple), inspired the […]

title: The space stories that will shape 2026
summary:

title: ESA Says Data Breach Was Limited to Servers with Unclassified Documents
summary:
The European Space Agency (ESA) has released an initial statement regarding an alleged data breach, stating that it affected a “very limited number of science servers located outside the ESA corporate network.” On 26 December, reports began to emerge on X claiming that ESA had suffered a significant data breach, with a hacker using the […]
The post ESA Says Data Breach Was Limited to Servers with Unclassified Documents appeared first on European Spaceflight.

title: Isaacman opens door to alternatives to moving shuttle Discovery to Houston
summary:
NASA Administrator Jared Isaacman suggested he would be open to transferring a spacecraft other than the space shuttle Discovery to Houston.
